items.fromString:
Parts 1 & 2 of design doc: Listing and filtering (and sorting)
== Acceptance Criteria ==
# The policy violation page will be rendered
items.toString:
Parts 1 & 2 of design doc: Listing and filtering (and sorting)
== Acceptance Criteria ==
# The policy violation page will be similar to the Policy Violations table that was part of the Important tab in identity access review
# The mockup for the page is [here|http://ux.sailpoint.com/identityiq/Prototypes_7.1/policy-violations/policy-violations-future.html#]
# The table will have the following columns:
## First Name
## Last Name
## Type
## Owner
## Rule 
## Description
## Status
## Decision (column will be fixed)
# The bulk decision button will allow the user to make Allow and Certify decisions
# The user will have the ability to filter on the columns that are part of the page
# When the user clicks on the filter button it will drop down and show the filter available
# Once the filter option has been selected the filter panel will collapse and the filter button will be shown in green to let the user know that filter is on

fields.summary: Dev: Backend REST/Service for fetching filters
Dev: Backed REST/Service for filtering results
Dev: Frontend Service/Ctrl for adding/sending filters
Research and refactoring for Policy decision story support
Column width changes when I sort by the columns

fields.description:
Parts 1 & 2 of design doc: Listing and filtering (and sorting)
== Acceptance Criteria ==
# The policy violation page will be similar to the Policy Violations table that was part of the Important tab in identity access review
# The mockup for the page is [here|http://ux.sailpoint.com/identityiq/Prototypes_7.1/policy-violations/policy-violations-future.html#]
# The table will have the following columns:
## First Name
## Last Name
## Type
## Owner
## Rule 
## Description
## Status
## Decision (column will be fixed)
# The bulk decision button will allow the user to make Allow and Certify decisions
# The user will have the ability to filter on the columns that are part of the page
# When the user clicks on the filter button it will drop down and show the filter available
# Once the filter option has been selected the filter panel will collapse and the filter button will be shown in green to let the user know that filter is on
